Test Case: Replay PCAP for OT service command
Description: Replay a packet capture of a dangerous OT-specific service commands (e.g. S7 stop) to simulate the traffic for passive OT security controls
Replay a packet capture of a dangerous Triton malware to simulate the traffic for passive OT security controls
Move laterally to another system using a remote service (e.g. SSH, RDP)

Test Case: Internal port scan against OT network
Description: Run internal port scan to probe for interesting OT-specific ports

Test Case: Network services scan against OT target
Description: Scan an OT system for OT-specific network services
Establish a bidirectional command-and-control connection from a managed asset to an external server on the Internet over MQTT
Copy a payload to a remote target
Attempt to login as a user via a remote service (e.g. SSH, Telnet) using multiple passwords

Test Case: Prompt a user with multiple MFA requests
Description: Using valid credentials for a user, prompt that user with multiple MFA requests in a short period of time in order to induce them to accept the prompt.
Send a spearphishing attachment containing a malicious macro payload to a target inbox
Send phishing email to victim containing an ISO attachment. ISO files can be used to bypass mark-of-the-web restrictions.
Send a link to a zipped DLL payload stored on a cloud storage service like Google Drive by using the sharing features of that service
Execute a malicious Office document on the endpoint that will load a macro stored in a remote template document

Load a legitimate and signed kernel driver that is vulnerable to exploitation. Refer to projects like KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU/) for potential vulnerable drivers to use. Vulnerable, signed drivers provide a privileged (kernel) execution mechanism to attackers, allowing them to bypass security controls they couldn't otherwise bypass, such as by killing protected processes.
Execute a malicious DLL's function directly using rundll32

Test Case: Bypass User Account Control (UAC) via fodhelper
Description: Bypass user account control (UAC) to move to a high-integrity execution context via fodhelper.exe and a Registry modification
Clear the Windows Event Log entries using the builtin wevtutil.exe to remove any attack indicators in the logs.

Test Case: Sideload a DLL into a legitimate application
Description: Rename an attacker-controlled DLL to the name of a DLL expected by a legitimate application, move that DLL to be adjacent to the application, then execute the application in order to trigger the loading of the DLL by the legitimate application.
Modify an IdP policy to be more permissive for authentication. For example, disable an Azure AD conditional access policy's MFA requirement.
Use PowerShell's Set-MpPreference to disable Windows Defender
Use nltest.exe to identify domain controllers in the domain

Test Case: Enumerate domain groups and users using net
Description: Enumerate domain users and domain groups using the builtin net.exe
Use BloodHound/SharpHound to perform enumeration of domain resources against a domain controller
Establish a bidirectional command-and-control connection from a managed asset to an external server on the Internet over HTTP
Establish a bidirectional command-and-control connection from a managed asset to an external server on the Internet over HTTPS
Establish connection to system using a legitimate remote assistance application
Download a tool from a public hosting location onto the victim system
Move to another system by using Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to spawn a process on that target system
Move to another system by creating a service remotely via Sysinternals PsExec
Perform an interactive logons to a Windows system via RDP
Persist on a system by creating a new scheduled task
Persist on a system by creating a new service
Run a payload during user login by setting a Registry Winlogon key
Run a payload during user login and startup by setting a registry run key

Test Case: Register a new device in Azure AD
Description: Register a new device in Azure AD
Convert a custom domain in the Azure Active Directory tenant into a federated domain. This can be used for persistent access into the tenant.

Test Case: Extract domain user credentials via replication
Description: Replicate a user's hash from a domain controller using replication APIs (DCSync).
Use nanodump to extract credentials from LSASS process memory

Test Case: Dump LSASS memory using builtin comsvcs.dll
Description: Use rundll32.exe and comsvcs.dll to dump LSASS process memory to disk

Test Case: Dump LSASS memory using Sysinternals ProcDump
Description: Use ProcDump from Sysinternals to dump LSASS process memory
Extract cookie information from the user's browser
Retrieve Kerberos TGS tickets from Active Directory for all users with service principal names (SPNs) set
Dump domain hashes for all domain users on the domain controller via ntdsutil.exe, which uses Volume Shadow Services (VSS)
Set the UseLogonCredential key in the WDigest hive to enable cleartext credential storage in-memory

Test Case: Register Security Service Provider (SSP) in LSASS
Description: Register an SSP DLL that into LSASS. This technique can be used by adversaries to harvest credentials that traverse through LSASS.

Test Case: Encrypt a large amount of files
Description: Encrypt a large amount of files on the endpoint to simulate ransomware
Delete native Windows backups
Delete volume shadow copies on the host to inhibit file system recovery
Modify a domain group policy object. This can be used for activities like persisting access to the environment, disabling security controls, and executing ransomware on domain systems.

Test Case: Extract data to cloud storage service
Description: Extract data from the internal network to a cloud storage service like MEGA, Google Drive, or Box
Extract data from the network over HTTP tcp/80 to an external host or IP.

Test Case: Extract sensitive data over HTTP C2
Description: Extract data from the network via an HTTP C2 channel over tcp/80 to external host or IP
Capture an image of the user's screen
Log user keystrokes
